page.title: 01Land Above Moulin
page.content: This block is south facing, overlooking Pitlochry and the Tummel Valley, with farmland at the bottom, plantations (mainly coniferous) on the middle slopes, and heather moorland, used for sheep grazing and grouse shooting, on the upper slopes. There are two mansion houses, Baledmund and Balnakelly, which have belonged to the same families for centuries. There is an ancient standing stone in the field below Baledmund. There is a public footpath to Ben Vrackie. Pitlochry golf course is in square number 10. In the coniferous woods there are rocky crags, one of which (Cragower) is a view point belonging to the national trust for Scotland. The old village of Moulin has a small square with church and inn and a local sub post office shop, also a bowling green.
